name: Hallow
text:
As an additional cost to play Hallow, return a total of 10 [bless] tokens to the token pool from the chaos bag or sealed on cards in play.
Remove 1 doom from any card in play.
real_text:
As an additional cost to play Hallow, return a total of 10 [bless] tokens to the token pool from the chaos bag or sealed on cards in play.
Remove 1 doom from any card in play.
flavor: Even in the deepest darkness, light can still bloom.

name: Holy Spear
text: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. When you initiate this ability, you may release a [bless] token sealed on Holy Spear. [action] Search the chaos bag for 2 [bless] tokens and seal them on Holy Spear: Fight. You get +4 [combat] and deal +2 damage for this attack.
real_text: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. When you initiate this ability, you may release a [bless] token sealed on Holy Spear. [action] Search the chaos bag for 2 [bless] tokens and seal them on Holy Spear: Fight. You get +4 [combat] and deal +2 damage for this attack.

name: Ancestral Knowledge
text:
Permanent. Exceptional.
Your deck must include at least 10 skills. Your deck size is increased by 5.
[reaction] Before drawing your opening hand: Attach 5 random non-weakness skills from your deck facedown to this card.
[fast] Exhaust Ancestral Knowledge: Draw 1 attached skill.
real_text:
Permanent. Exceptional.
Your deck must include at least 10 skills. Your deck size is increased by 5.
[reaction] Before drawing your opening hand: Attach 5 random non-weakness skills from your deck facedown to this card.
[fast] Exhaust Ancestral Knowledge: Draw 1 attached skill.

name: Ariadne's Twine
text:
Uses (0 secrets).
Secrets on Ariadne's Twine can be spent as if they were on any asset controlled by an investigator at your location.
[free] Exhaust Ariadne's Twine: Move 1 secret from an asset you control to your resource pool, as a resource, or vice versa.
real_text:
Uses (0 secrets).
Secrets on Ariadne's Twine can be spent as if they were on any asset controlled by an investigator at your location.
[free] Exhaust Ariadne's Twine: Move 1 secret from an asset you control to your resource pool, as a resource, or vice versa.

name: .25 Automatic
text: Fast. Uses (4 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. If the attacked enemy is exhausted, you get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. [reaction] After you evade an enemy at your location: Perform the above Fight ability without spending an action.
real_text: Fast. Uses (4 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. If the attacked enemy is exhausted, you get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. [reaction] After you evade an enemy at your location: Perform the above Fight ability without spending an action.

name: Justify the Means
text:
You may commit Justify the Means to any type of test.
As an additional cost to commit Justify the Means to a skill test, add [curse] tokens to the chaos bag equal to this test's difficulty.
This test automatically succeeds.
real_text:
You may commit Justify the Means to any type of test.
As an additional cost to commit Justify the Means to a skill test, add [curse] tokens to the chaos bag equal to this test's difficulty.
This test automatically succeeds.

name: Lucky Dice
text:
Exceptional.
[reaction] When you reveal a non-[curse], non-[auto_fail] chaos token, add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag: Ignore the just revealed chaos token and reveal another one to resolve. If that token has a [curse] or [auto_fail] symbol, return Lucky Dice to your hand (cannot be ignored/canceled).
real_text:
Exceptional.
[reaction] When you reveal a non-[curse], non-[auto_fail] chaos token, add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag: Ignore the just revealed chaos token and reveal another one to resolve. If that token has a [curse] or [auto_fail] symbol, return Lucky Dice to your hand (cannot be ignored/canceled).

name: Rite of Equilibrium
text:
Either (choose one):
- Add X [curse] tokens to the chaos bag to add X [bless] tokens to the chaos bag.
- Remove X [curse] and X [bless] tokens from the chaos bag to heal X total horror from among cards at your location.
real_text:
Either (choose one):
- Add X [curse] tokens to the chaos bag to add X [bless] tokens to the chaos bag.
- Remove X [curse] and X [bless] tokens from the chaos bag to heal X total horror from among cards at your location.

name: Jacob Morrison
text:
Jacob Morrison does not ready during the upkeep phase.
[reaction] When you would fail a skill test, exhaust Jacob Morrison: You get +2 skill value for that test.
[reaction] After a [bless] token is revealed from the chaos bag during a skill test you are performing: Ready Jacob Morrison.
real_text:
Jacob Morrison does not ready during the upkeep phase.
[reaction] When you would fail a skill test, exhaust Jacob Morrison: You get +2 skill value for that test.
[reaction] After a [bless] token is revealed from the chaos bag during a skill test you are performing: Ready Jacob Morrison.

name: Shrine of the Moirai
text: Attach to your location. Uses (3 offerings). Attached location gains: "[fast] Draw the top card of the encounter deck, exhaust Shrine of the Moirai, and spend 1 offering: Return up to 2 cards with a total combined level of 5 or less from your discard pile to your hand. Any investigator at this location may trigger this ability." Card design by the Moirai at Arkham Nights 2019.
real_text: Attach to your location. Uses (3 offerings). Attached location gains: "[fast] Draw the top card of the encounter deck, exhaust Shrine of the Moirai, and spend 1 offering: Return up to 2 cards with a total combined level of 5 or less from your discard pile to your hand. Any investigator at this location may trigger this ability." Card design by the Moirai at Arkham Nights 2019.

name: Into the Maelstrom
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 (-3 instead if there are 4 or more unflooded [[Y'ha-nthlei]] locations in play).
[cultist]: -3. If you fail, place 1 doom on the current agenda (this may cause the current agenda to advance).
[tablet]: -4. If you fail, you must either increase the flood level of your location or take 1 damage.
[elder_thing]: -5. If you fail and there is a key on your location, take 1 horror.
real_text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 (-3 instead if there are 4 or more unflooded [[Y'ha-nthlei]] locations in play).
[cultist]: -3. If you fail, place 1 doom on the current agenda (this may cause the current agenda to advance).
[tablet]: -4. If you fail, you must either increase the flood level of your location or take 1 damage.
[elder_thing]: -5. If you fail and there is a key on your location, take 1 horror.
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -2 (-4 instead if there are 4 or more unflooded [[Y'ha-nthlei]] locations in play).
[cultist]: -4. If you fail, place 1 doom on the current agenda (this may cause the current agenda to advance).
[tablet]: -5. If you fail, you must either increase the flood level of your location or take 1 damage.
[elder_thing]: -6. If you fail and there is a key on your location, take 1 horror.

name: Under the Surface
text: Forced - When your turn begins, if you are at a fully flooded location, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter an unflooded or partially flooded location during your turn, take 5 direct damage.
real_text: Forced - When your turn begins, if you are at a fully flooded location, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter an unflooded or partially flooded location during your turn, take 5 direct damage.
flavor: Your boat lands on the black reef, and you descend once more into the tidal caverns. Deeper and deeper still you travel, until all thoughts of returning to the surface seem like fantasy.
back_text: Shuffle the set-aside Lloigor enemy and the set-aside Aquatic Abomination enemy into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile.
back_flavor: The waters continue to roil in ebullient energy, as if somehow alive. With each passing moment, the sea grows more and more volatile. Stranger still are the monstrous creatures that now prowl the dark waters - creatures that defy all laws of nature...

name: Celestial Alignment
text: Forced - When your turn begins, if you are at a fully flooded location, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter an unflooded or partially flooded location during your turn, take 5 direct damage.
real_text: Forced - When your turn begins, if you are at a fully flooded location, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter an unflooded or partially flooded location during your turn, take 5 direct damage.
flavor: Even this deep beneath the surface of the ocean, you can tell that your time is running short. You feel the pull of the tide as it courses through the water. Every bone in your body quakes. The walls breathe as though alive.
back_text: If Hydra is in play, flip her to her (Awakened and Enraged) side. If Dagon is in play and slumbering, flip him to his (Awakened and Enraged) side.

name: The Flood
text: If an [[Ancient One]] enemy is slumbering, flip it to its (Awakened and Enraged) side. Forced - When your turn begins, if you are at a fully flooded location, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter an unflooded or partially flooded location during your turn, take 5 direct damage.
real_text: If an [[Ancient One]] enemy is slumbering, flip it to its (Awakened and Enraged) side. Forced - When your turn begins, if you are at a fully flooded location, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter an unflooded or partially flooded location during your turn, take 5 direct damage.
flavor: The great flood has begun. With the ritual complete, the seas shall overtake the Earth, and there will be nothing left but the primordial ocean and its denizens. You are all that stands in the way of humanity's extinction.
back_flavor: The chanting of the Deep Ones rises to a crescendo. The alien walls of Y'ha-nthlei twist and contort before your eyes, like lungs desperately clawing for breath. The air becomes thin. Water seeps through the walls. Nothing can stop the pull of the tide now. Nothing can stop the great flood. A triumphant roar sounds throughout the city, and the citizens of the deep rise to meet the cry in their jubilance. You collapse in exhaustion and resignation. Your part is over, now. The part of humanity will soon follow.

name: Back into the Depths
text: Objective - If each investigator is at Gateway to Y'ha-nthlei and the investigators possess each of the following keys (blue, red, yellow, and green), you may choose to advance.
real_text: Objective - If each investigator is at Gateway to Y'ha-nthlei and the investigators possess each of the following keys (blue, red, yellow, and green), you may choose to advance.
flavor: Finally you reach the gateway to the final depths: a swirling vortex of otherworldly currents beyond which Y'ha-nthlei, the city of the Deep Ones, waits. Somehow, you must gain entrance...
back_text: Remove each location other than Gateway to Y'ha-nthlei from the game (or add them to the victory display if they have Victory X and no clues remaining). Discard each card at those locations. Put set-aside locations into play as shown in the Campaign Guide, following the "Act 2 Setup" instructions. (Note that the number of Y'ha-nthlei locations used and the arrangement of the locations varies depending on the number of investigators in the game.) Put the set-aside Hydra enemy into play in the Lair of Hydra, (Deep in Slumber) side faceup. Put the set-aside Dagon enemy into play in the Lair of Dagon. Check Campaign Log. If Dagon has awakened, he enters play (Awakened and Enraged) side faceup. If Dagon still slumbers, he enters play (Deep in Slumber) side faceup.
back_flavor: A maelstrom of currents tugs at your flesh as you cross through the gateway. When you emerge on the other side, you are no longer in the simple tidal caverns beneath Devil Reef, but inside a vast city within the depths: a city of otherworldly, alien architecture and, surprisingly, riches beyond your wildest imagination.

name: City of the Deep (v. I)
text: [fast] Either remove 1 [per_investigator] damage from an [[Ancient One]] enemy at your location, or investigators at a [[Lair]] location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Decrease the flood level of any non-[[Sanctum]] location in play Objective - Stop the Deep Ones' ritual by draining the city. If each location in play is unflooded, advance.
real_text: [fast] Either remove 1 [per_investigator] damage from an [[Ancient One]] enemy at your location, or investigators at a [[Lair]] location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Decrease the flood level of any non-[[Sanctum]] location in play Objective - Stop the Deep Ones' ritual by draining the city. If each location in play is unflooded, advance.
flavor: Deep within the city of Y'ha-nthlei, the Deep Ones are performing a ritual that will drown the Earth under the seas. The only way to counteract this ritual is to unveil the depths and expose the city to the sky.
back_text: Add this card to the victory display. - If there is another act card in play, you may choose to either continue playing in order to accomplish the objective on that act card, or proceed immediately to (→R1) without fulfilling that objective. - If there are no other act cards in play, proceed to (→R1). Victory 2.
back_flavor: The seas part with a roaring torrent. Chill air flows through the corridors of Y'ha-nthlei as it rises. When the stars look down upon its alien, emerald halls, something in the air changes. There is a sound like a snap and the hissing of air being pulled through the vacuum of space. Then, like automobiles lurching to life, the Earth and the Moon begin to move once more.

name: City of the Deep (v. II)
text: Objective - Recover the riches of the Deep Ones. If the Lair of Dagon, the Lair of Hydra, and the Vault of Riches with the purple key have no clues on them, advance.
real_text: Objective - Recover the riches of the Deep Ones. If the Lair of Dagon, the Lair of Hydra, and the Vault of Riches with the purple key have no clues on them, advance.
flavor: You've agreed to help Agent Harper complete her mission to find and bring back the vast wealth of Y'ha-nthlei. Who knows what the government will do with such riches...
back_text: Add this card to the victory display. - If there is another act card in play, you may choose to either continue playing in order to accomplish the objective on that act card, or proceed immediately to (→R1) without fulfilling that objective. - If there are no other act cards in play, proceed to (→R1). Victory 2.
back_flavor: The gold and jewels hoarded in the vaults of the Deep Ones are too plentiful to count. There is no doubt in your mind: This is how the creatures - and by proxy, the Esoteric Order of Dagon - were able to manipulate the people of Innsmouth and bring more into their fold. Even a few handfuls of such riches would be enough for one to live comfortably for the rest of their life. You and Agent Harper grab only the most valuable relics you can find, leaving the rest to sink with the remainder of the city. "We have submarines stationed off the coast. When we're done here, they'll blow this place apart," she explains.

name: City of the Deep (v. III)
text: Objective - Collapse the vault containing the Deep Ones' riches. If Dagon and Hydra each have at least 4 [per_investigator] damage on them, advance.
real_text: Objective - Collapse the vault containing the Deep Ones' riches. If Dagon and Hydra each have at least 4 [per_investigator] damage on them, advance.
flavor: You refuse to be a pawn in the government's schemes. Even so, you don't wish Agent Harper to come to any harm. You tell her to escape while she can, and she slips away, cursing under her breath. Now you have a new goal - send the riches of Y'ha-nthlei into the depths so they can never again be used against humanity.
back_text: Add this card to the victory display. - If there is another act card in play, you may choose to either continue playing in order to accomplish the objective on that act card, or proceed immediately to (→R1) without fulfilling that objective. - If there are no other act cards in play, proceed to (→R1). Victory 2.
back_flavor: With the deities of the Deep Ones thrashing and howling in pain, sections of the city begin to collapse all around you. Hoping to use this to your advantage, you lure the creatures closer and closer to the vaults where their riches are held. The vast hoards of gold and jewels are no doubt how the creatures - and by proxy, the Esoteric Order of Dagon - were able to manipulate the people of Innsmouth and bring more into their fold. You cannot let that ever happen again. One final blow sends one of the creatures staggering through the wall. The ceiling collapses, and a torrent of seawater follows. You escape just before you are caught inside.

name: Dark Abyss
text: Forced - After Dark Abyss is revealed: Randomly choose 1 of the set-aside facedown keys and place it on Dark Abyss without looking at it. Forced - After the last clue is discovered from Dark Abyss: Dark Abyss becomes fully flooded. Increase the flood level of each location connected to Dark Abyss.
real_text: Forced - After Dark Abyss is revealed: Randomly choose 1 of the set-aside facedown keys and place it on Dark Abyss without looking at it. Forced - After the last clue is discovered from Dark Abyss: Dark Abyss becomes fully flooded. Increase the flood level of each location connected to Dark Abyss.
back_flavor: The air is frigid here, and there is no sound but the faint plinking of water dripping onto the rough stone ground. You shudder and proceed onward...

name: Gateway to Y'ha-nthlei
flavor: The gateway to the city of the deep is a roiling vortex of seawater - a portal of currents beyond which lies Y'ha-nthlei, your final destination.
back_text: Gateway to Y'ha-nthlei enters play partially flooded (even while it is unrevealed).
back_flavor: "Stupendous and unheard-of splendours await me below, and I shall seek them soon." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>

name: Sunken Halls
text: [action] If you control the black key: Place it on Sunken Halls. Forced - After an enemy enters Sunken Halls, if the black key is on Sunken Halls: Deal 2 damage to that enemy.
real_text: [action] If you control the black key: Place it on Sunken Halls. Forced - After an enemy enters Sunken Halls, if the black key is on Sunken Halls: Deal 2 damage to that enemy.
back_text: Y'ha-nthlei enters play partially flooded (even while it is unrevealed).
back_flavor: "We shall swim out to that brooding reef in the sea and dive down through black abysses to Cyclopean and many-columned Y'ha-nthlei..." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>

name: Vault of Riches
text: [action] If you control the purple key: Place it on Vault of Riches. Then, choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at any location. Automatically evade that enemy and move it to Vault of Riches. That enemy does not ready during the next upkeep phase. (Group limit once per game.)
real_text: [action] If you control the purple key: Place it on Vault of Riches. Then, choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at any location. Automatically evade that enemy and move it to Vault of Riches. That enemy does not ready during the next upkeep phase. (Group limit once per game.)
back_text: Y'ha-nthlei enters play partially flooded (even while it is unrevealed).
back_flavor: "We shall swim out to that brooding reef in the sea and dive down through black abysses to Cyclopean and many-columned Y'ha-nthlei..." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>

name: Undersea Corridors
text: [action] If you control the white key: Place it on Undersea Corridors. [fast] If the white key is on Undersea Corridors: Move. Move to a connecting location. (Limit once per round.)
real_text: [action] If you control the white key: Place it on Undersea Corridors. [fast] If the white key is on Undersea Corridors: Move. Move to a connecting location. (Limit once per round.)
back_text: Y'ha-nthlei enters play partially flooded (even while it is unrevealed).
back_flavor: "We shall swim out to that brooding reef in the sea and dive down through black abysses to Cyclopean and many-columned Y'ha-nthlei..." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>

name: Statues in the Deep
text: [action] If you control the blue key, place it on this location and investigators here spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Automatically evade each [[Ancient One]] enemy. Unflood this location. For the remainder of the game, this location cannot be flooded. (Group limit once per game.) Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating this location: Take 1 damage.
real_text: [action] If you control the blue key, place it on this location and investigators here spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Automatically evade each [[Ancient One]] enemy. Unflood this location. For the remainder of the game, this location cannot be flooded. (Group limit once per game.) Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating this location: Take 1 damage.
back_text: Y'ha-nthlei Sanctum enters play fully flooded (even while it is unrevealed).
back_flavor: "... in that lair of the Deep Ones we shall dwell amidst wonder and glory for ever." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>

name: Submerged Temple
text:
Each [[Deep One]] enemy at this location gets +2 fight.
[action] If you control the green key, place it on this location and investigators here spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Automatically evade each [[Ancient One]] enemy. Unflood this location. For the remainder of the game, this location cannot be flooded. (Group limit once per game.)
real_text:
Each [[Deep One]] enemy at this location gets +2 fight.
[action] If you control the green key, place it on this location and investigators here spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Automatically evade each [[Ancient One]] enemy. Unflood this location. For the remainder of the game, this location cannot be flooded. (Group limit once per game.)
back_text: Y'ha-nthlei Sanctum enters play fully flooded (even while it is unrevealed).
back_flavor: "... in that lair of the Deep Ones we shall dwell amidst wonder and glory for ever." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>

name: Syzygy Chamber
text: [action] If you control the red key, place it on this location and investigators here spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Automatically evade each [[Ancient One]] enemy. Unflood this location. For the remainder of the game, this location cannot be flooded. (Group limit once per game.) Forced - After any location's flood value is increased: Each investigator at this location takes 1 horror.
real_text: [action] If you control the red key, place it on this location and investigators here spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Automatically evade each [[Ancient One]] enemy. Unflood this location. For the remainder of the game, this location cannot be flooded. (Group limit once per game.) Forced - After any location's flood value is increased: Each investigator at this location takes 1 horror.
back_text: Y'ha-nthlei Sanctum enters play fully flooded (even while it is unrevealed).
back_flavor: "... in that lair of the Deep Ones we shall dwell amidst wonder and glory for ever." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>

name: Onyx Guardians
text:
During the enemy phase, each ready [[Ancient One]] enemy can attack investigators here as if they were engaged.
[action] If you control the yellow key, place it on this location and investigators here spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Automatically evade each [[Ancient One]] enemy. Unflood this location. For the remainder of the game, this location cannot be flooded. (Group limit once per game.)
real_text:
During the enemy phase, each ready [[Ancient One]] enemy can attack investigators here as if they were engaged.
[action] If you control the yellow key, place it on this location and investigators here spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Automatically evade each [[Ancient One]] enemy. Unflood this location. For the remainder of the game, this location cannot be flooded. (Group limit once per game.)
back_text: Y'ha-nthlei Sanctum enters play fully flooded (even while it is unrevealed).

name: Lair of Dagon
text: Lair of Dagon gets -1 shroud for each [[Sanctum]] location with a key on it. [fast] Check Campaign Log. If all 7 keys are on locations and the Order's ritual was disrupted: You dig deep into your memories to recall what happened the last time you were here. Read Flashback XIV in the Campaign Guide.
real_text: Lair of Dagon gets -1 shroud for each [[Sanctum]] location with a key on it. [fast] Check Campaign Log. If all 7 keys are on locations and the Order's ritual was disrupted: You dig deep into your memories to recall what happened the last time you were here. Read Flashback XIV in the Campaign Guide.
back_flavor: As you descend the familiar steps, something tugs at your memories. You've been here before, haven't you?

name: Lair of Hydra
text:
Lair of Hydra gets -1 shroud for each [[Sanctum]] location with a key on it.
[action] Place the black, purple, or white key on this location: Deal 3 damage to an [[Ancient One]] enemy that is not slumbering. (Group limit once per game.)
real_text:
Lair of Hydra gets -1 shroud for each [[Sanctum]] location with a key on it.
[action] Place the black, purple, or white key on this location: Deal 3 damage to an [[Ancient One]] enemy that is not slumbering. (Group limit once per game.)
back_flavor: Amidst the sound of cascading waterfalls, the deep rumbling of something enormous stirring emanates from below. Each of the thing's breaths resounds throughout the city, shaking the walls, filling your heart with fear, and yet, calling to you.

name: Dagon
text: Dagon is slumbering. He cannot attack or engage, and is immune to investigator actions and player card effects. Forced - At the end of the investigation phase, if an investigator is in Lair of Dagon and Dagon is ready: Place 1 doom on him. [action]: Test [willpower] (4). If you succeed, either exhaust Dagon or remove 1 doom from him. If you fail by 3 or more, place 1 doom on him.
real_text: Dagon is slumbering. He cannot attack or engage, and is immune to investigator actions and player card effects. Forced - At the end of the investigation phase, if an investigator is in Lair of Dagon and Dagon is ready: Place 1 doom on him. [action]: Test [willpower] (4). If you succeed, either exhaust Dagon or remove 1 doom from him. If you fail by 3 or more, place 1 doom on him.

linked_card.name: Dagon
linked_card.text:
Hunter. Massive. Retaliate.

Dagon gets -1 fight for each Sanctum location with a key on it.

Forced - After Dagon is evaded or dealt damage: Do the same to a copy of Dagon's Brood in play, as well.
linked_card.real_text: Hunter. Massive. Retaliate. Dagon gets -1 fight for each [[Sanctum]] location with a key on it. Forced - After Dagon is evaded or dealt damage: Do the same to a copy of Dagon's Brood in play, as well.

name: Hydra
text: Hydra is slumbering. She cannot attack or engage, and is immune to investigator actions and player card effects. Forced - At the end of the investigation phase, if an investigator is in Lair of Hydra and Hydra is ready: Place 1 doom on her. [action]: Test [willpower] (4). If you succeed, either exhaust Hydra or remove 1 doom from her. If you fail by 3 or more, place 1 doom on her.
real_text: Hydra is slumbering. She cannot attack or engage, and is immune to investigator actions and player card effects. Forced - At the end of the investigation phase, if an investigator is in Lair of Hydra and Hydra is ready: Place 1 doom on her. [action]: Test [willpower] (4). If you succeed, either exhaust Hydra or remove 1 doom from her. If you fail by 3 or more, place 1 doom on her.

linked_card.name: Hydra
linked_card.text:
Hunter. Massive. Retaliate.

Hydra gets -1 fight for each Sanctum location with a key on it.

Forced - After Hydra is evaded or dealt damage: Do the same to a copy of Hydra's Brood in play, as well.
linked_card.real_text: Hunter. Massive. Retaliate. Hydra gets -1 fight for each [[Sanctum]] location with a key on it. Forced - After Hydra is evaded or dealt damage: Do the same to a copy of Hydra's Brood in play, as well.

name: Aquatic Abomination
text:
Hunter.
While Aquatic Abomination is moving, fully flooded locations are considered to be connected to one another.
Aquatic Abomination cannot attack during the same phase it moved via its hunter keyword.
real_text:
Hunter.
While Aquatic Abomination is moving, fully flooded locations are considered to be connected to one another.
Aquatic Abomination cannot attack during the same phase it moved via its hunter keyword.

name: Dagon's Brood
text: Spawn - Lair of Dagon or Gateway to Y'ha-nthlei (whichever is farther from you). Hunter. Forced - After Dagon's Brood engages you, if Dagon is in play: Either place 1 doom on Dagon, or Dagon attacks you.
real_text: Spawn - Lair of Dagon or Gateway to Y'ha-nthlei (whichever is farther from you). Hunter. Forced - After Dagon's Brood engages you, if Dagon is in play: Either place 1 doom on Dagon, or Dagon attacks you.

name: Hydra's Brood
text: Spawn - Lair of Hydra or Gateway to Y'ha-nthlei (whichever is farther from you). Hunter. Forced - After Hydra's Brood engages you, if Hydra is in play: Either place 1 doom on Hydra, or Hydra attacks you.
real_text: Spawn - Lair of Hydra or Gateway to Y'ha-nthlei (whichever is farther from you). Hunter. Forced - After Hydra's Brood engages you, if Hydra is in play: Either place 1 doom on Hydra, or Hydra attacks you.

name: Treacherous Depths
text: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Increase the flood level of your current location. - Discard assets from your play area with a total resource cost of at least X, where X is your location's shroud value.
real_text: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Increase the flood level of your current location. - Discard assets from your play area with a total resource cost of at least X, where X is your location's shroud value.

name: Conspiracy of Deep Ones
text: Peril. Revelation - Test [willpower] (2). This test gets +1 difficulty for each [[Sanctum]] location with a key on it. If you fail, you must either place 1 doom on the current agenda (this effect may cause the current agenda to advance), or the nearest [[Ancient One]] enemy in play attacks you.
real_text: Peril. Revelation - Test [willpower] (2). This test gets +1 difficulty for each [[Sanctum]] location with a key on it. If you fail, you must either place 1 doom on the current agenda (this effect may cause the current agenda to advance), or the nearest [[Ancient One]] enemy in play attacks you.

name: Thalassophobia
text: Revelation - If no investigators are at flooded locations, Thalassophobia gains surge. Otherwise, each investigator at a partially flooded location takes 1 horror, and each investigator at a fully flooded location takes 1 direct horror that cannot be prevented.
real_text: Revelation - If no investigators are at flooded locations, Thalassophobia gains surge. Otherwise, each investigator at a partially flooded location takes 1 horror, and each investigator at a fully flooded location takes 1 direct horror that cannot be prevented.

name: Diving Suit
text: You ignore the Forced ability on the current agenda. Forced - When any amount of damage would be placed on you: Place 1 of that damage on Diving Suit. Forced - When Diving Suit leaves play: Remove it from the game.
real_text: You ignore the Forced ability on the current agenda. Forced - When any amount of damage would be placed on you: Place 1 of that damage on Diving Suit. Forced - When Diving Suit leaves play: Remove it from the game.
